name: Eczema
description: A chronic condition that causes the skin to become itchy, red, dry and cracked. Atopic dermatitis is the most common form of eczema, and it primarily affects children but can continue into adulthood.

early_stage.description: Acute Eczema: Intense itching, visible redness (erythema), and tiny blisters (vesicles) that may weep fluid.

middle_stage.description: Subacute Eczema: Less weeping/crusting. Skin becomes dry, flaky, and scaly with red borders.

advanced_stage.description: Chronic Eczema: Lichenification (thickening of the skin) from constant scratching. Skin looks leathery and exaggerated.

causes: Unknown precise cause. Believed to be a combination of genetic factors (gene variation affecting skin barrier function), immune system dysfunction, and environmental triggers.

favorable_conditions.environment: Exposure to allergens (dust mites, pollen), irritants (soaps, detergents)

impact.prevalence: Affects 15-20% of children and 1-3% of adults globally
impact.socio_economic_impact: Disrupts sleep, reduces quality of life, increases medical costs for long-term management.

diagnosis.field_diagnosis: Visual examination of skin and family history review
diagnosis.laboratory_diagnosis: Patch testing (for contact dermatitis), Skin biopsy (rarely needed), IgE blood tests (for allergies).

susceptible_populations: Children, Individuals with family history of atopic triad (eczema, asthma, hay fever).
life_cycle: Often begins in infancy. Many children outgrow it, but it can persist or recur in adulthood.

dataset_metadata.intended_use: Machine learning training, research, and educational purpose
